thread.title: Migrants taken off Hungarian train near refugee camp
thread.title_full: Migrants taken off Hungarian train near refugee camp | News24

author: news24.com
title: Migrants taken off Hungarian train near refugee camp
text:
Budapest - A Hungarian train bound for towns near the Austrian border with several hundred migrants onboard was stopped near one of the country's four main refugee camps and the migrants taken off, state news agency MTI reported.
The train stopped at Bicske, around 40 km west of Budapest, and police took the migrants off and directed them onto buses to take them to the nearby camp, MTI reported from the scene.
AFP estimated there were around 200-300 migrants on board.
The train, which left the main Keleti station at 11:20 was due to split, with three carriages due to travel to Szonbathely and the rest to Sopron, both near Hungary's western border with Austria.
